rev.comment: updating, Canonical no longer requires the ownership/copyright of contributions
rev.diff:
Line 148: Line 148:
In December 2008, Canonical announced that the source code to the Launchpad website would be released under a free software license by 21 July 2009.<ref>[http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=oRa0fZTu-ms Youtube - UDS Jaunty - Graham Binns]</ref><ref name="opensourcing launchpad">[https://dev.launchpad.net/OpenSourcing Dev.launchpad.net], OpenSourcing</ref> It was also announced that two large components of Launchpad, Soyuz (which is responsible for the build system, package management and Ubuntu package publishing) and Codehosting, would not be released under a free software license.<ref name="blog-how">[http://blog.launchpad.net/general/how-we-are-open-sourcing-launchpad Blog.launchpad.net], "How we are open sourcing launchpad"</ref> Later, the specific date was changed to a more general timeframe of July/August 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://dev.launchpad.net/OpenSourcing|title=Open Sourcing Launchpad|publisher=Canonical Ltd.|accessdate=2009-07-04|quote=The process should be completed in July / August 2009.}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/canonical-open-sources-launchpad|title=Canonical releases source code for Launchpad|publisher=Canonical Ltd.|accessdate=2009-07-21|quote=Canonical, the founder of the Ubuntu project, announced today that it has open-sourced the code that runs Launchpad, the software development and collaboration platform used by tens of thousands of developers.}}</ref> However, on 21 July 2009, the software was released under the [[AGPL|AGPLv3]] (a fully free license specifically for web services),<ref>[https://dev.launchpad.net/LaunchpadLicense Launchpad License]</ref> including the two components (Codehosting and Soyuz) that were initially planned to remain proprietary.<ref>[http://blog.launchpad.net/general/launchpad-is-now-open-source Launchpad is now open source.]</ref>
In December 2008, Canonical announced that the source code to the Launchpad website would be released under a free software license by 21 July 2009.<ref>[http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=oRa0fZTu-ms Youtube - UDS Jaunty - Graham Binns]</ref><ref name="opensourcing launchpad">[https://dev.launchpad.net/OpenSourcing Dev.launchpad.net], OpenSourcing</ref> It was also announced that two large components of Launchpad, Soyuz (which is responsible for the build system, package management and Ubuntu package publishing) and Codehosting, would not be released under a free software license.<ref name="blog-how">[http://blog.launchpad.net/general/how-we-are-open-sourcing-launchpad Blog.launchpad.net], "How we are open sourcing launchpad"</ref> Later, the specific date was changed to a more general timeframe of July/August 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://dev.launchpad.net/OpenSourcing|title=Open Sourcing Launchpad|publisher=Canonical Ltd.|accessdate=2009-07-04|quote=The process should be completed in July / August 2009.}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/canonical-open-sources-launchpad|title=Canonical releases source code for Launchpad|publisher=Canonical Ltd.|accessdate=2009-07-21|quote=Canonical, the founder of the Ubuntu project, announced today that it has open-sourced the code that runs Launchpad, the software development and collaboration platform used by tens of thousands of developers.}}</ref> However, on 21 July 2009, the software was released under the [[AGPL|AGPLv3]] (a fully free license specifically for web services),<ref>[https://dev.launchpad.net/LaunchpadLicense Launchpad License]</ref> including the two components (Codehosting and Soyuz) that were initially planned to remain proprietary.<ref>[http://blog.launchpad.net/general/launchpad-is-now-open-source Launchpad is now open source.]</ref>
â   â
The Launchpad software is subject to [[Canonical's contributor agreement]], allowing Canonical to release it under a non-[[Open-source license|open source]] license.<ref name="main">{{cite web | url = http://www.canonical.com/contributors | accessdate = 2011-08-10 | title = Canonical's contributor agreement}}</ref>
